definition[0]: to realize that someone is trying to deceive you
example[1]: I could never lie to her because I know she’d see through me straight away.
example[2]: I can’t bluff – she’d see right through me.
definition[1]: to continue doing something until it is finished, especially something difficult or unpleasant
example[3]: It’ll take a lot of effort to see the project through.
definition[2]: to give help and support to someone during a difficult time
example[4]: Setting goals should help see you through.
example[5]: I’ve got enough money to see me through six months of unemployment.
definition[3]: to see something or think about it in the way that someone else does
example[6]: The world is very different when seen through the eyes of a child.
definition[4]: a see-through material or surface allows you to see through it
